intro: Pentas angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pentas, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its blooms are not only visually appealing but also attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
